Problem with these methods is that you have to specify the type of the tensor, while using torch.LongTensor is convenient and directly give a torch.LongTensor. I would say casting a np.int64 array to a torch.LongTensor tensor should not be giving an error.
I understand that converting a np.int64 or a np.float32 to a torch.IntTensor might result in errors / imprecisions and could raise an error, but converting a np.int32 or an np.64 to a torch.LongTensor should not IMO.

body:
Problem with these methods is that you have to specify the type of the tensor, while using `torch.LongTensor` is convenient and directly give a `torch.LongTensor`. I would say casting a np.int64 array to a torch.LongTensor tensor should not be giving an error.
I understand that converting a np.int64 or a np.float32 to a torch.IntTensor might result in errors / imprecisions and could raise an error, but converting a np.int32 or an np.64 to a torch.LongTensor should not IMO.
